ingredients.item: 250g Waitrose & Partners Cherries, pitted with a cherry pitter

instructions.step: Preheat the oven to 220˚C, gas mark 7. Roll out the pastry on a lightly floured surface then use a plate as a guide to cut out a 21-22cm circle; set aside.
Put the butter and sugar in a 20cm heavy-based ovenproof frying pan over a low heat, until melted and dissolved; bubble for a few minutes until just golden. Take off the heat and add the cherries.

Cover with the pastry disc, then tuck the edges of the pastry inside the frying pan. Bake for 20-25 minutes until the pastry is golden and crisp. Leave to cool for 5 minutes before inverting onto a plate. Meanwhile, whip the double cream to soft peaks then stir in the Cointreau. Serve the tarte tatin with a dollop of the cream.
